meanings.definition: Make (something) global in scope or application.
meanings.sent1: The company globalised its products by selling them in many countries.
meanings.sent2: Businesses often globalise their operations to reach more customers.
meanings.sent3: The idea of globalising a local food festival seemed both ambitious and exciting.
meanings.sent4: Her passion for travel globalised her perspective on different cultures.
meanings.sent5: The internet has globalised communication, connecting people worldwide instantly.

meanings.definition: Become global in scope or application.
meanings.sent1: Over time, the small business globalised and expanded its reach.
meanings.sent2: As technology advances, more industries are globalising to stay competitive.
meanings.sent3: The tiny plant globalised its presence in the garden by spreading its seeds far and wide.
meanings.sent4: His influence globalised, reaching corners of the world he never imagined.
meanings.sent5: The music industry globalised with the rise of streaming platforms, reaching listeners globally.
